body.p:
Winchester Ky Novr 3rd 1863
Thos E Bramlette Esq
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

On yesterday 2d Novr 1863 being the first day of the Novr Term of the Clark Circuit Court a Judgment was rendered in favor of the Commonwealth against Ovadick Curry on forfeited Recognizance for $500. as the surety of Geo W Hensley who was indicted as a person of Bad fame. Hensley failed to appear having joined the Rebel Army. About 20th July 1863 Hensley was killed at Buffington; he being in Morgans Command.
I respectfully ask for, Mr Curry or remission of the Judgment.

Curry is a Southern sympathizer but as many of great personal cleverness, kind & obeying. To John B Huston & myself he has repeatedly shown acts of kindness by warning us of danger from Rebels & aiding us to escape -- has protected our property in our home from violation -- for two months while the Rebels, were here allowed no one to enter our rooms at his hotel.

When Clarke drove us all from home the Rebels stole a valuable horse belonging to my son who was about in the Federal Army, Curry claimed the horse as his own, dismounted the Rebel & locked up the horse with his own horse, and the Rebels having seized two valuable horses of Thos H Moore Provost Marshall 7 Congl District, Curry went to release them and did save them, and while so employed the Rebels broke open his stable & took his horse as well as my sons & they were both lost. I mention these things to show the kindness of the man & his devotion to
his friends -- I might fill pages with incidents showing his great cleverness as a man. Hensley is dead leaving no estate & Curry will have to pay the Atty for Comth his 30 percent which will be a pretty good lesson to him, if any were needed.
I hope that you may feel sufficiently justified to exercise executive Clemency & remit his fine --
If remitted let the Secretary send it to me so that I may not have to tax Curry further with Sheriff's in our Fi Fa.

Yours Truly
A. H. Buckner Clk
Clark Cir Court

Clark Cir Ct
vs
C. Curry
$500.
Forfeiture

Remit all except fees & costs
Nov 4th 1863
Tho E Bramlette
Govr of Ky

enclose to
A. H. Buckner
Clk Cir. Court
Winchester Ky
